alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Powell; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 4:29PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Powell, central Laurel, Estill, eastern Pulaski, western Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 500 PM EST... At 428 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Richmond to Somerset Pulaski Airport. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Winston, Kings Station, Rice Station, Fox, Blackburn, Witt and Station Camp around 440 PM EST. Irvine, Ravenna, Billows, Wiseman Crossing Station, Calloway Crossing, Hargett, Sandhill, North Irvine, Weedon and West Irvine around 445 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wood Creek Lake, Cottage Furnace, Hardwick, Vaughns Mill, Hare, Bernstadt, Hazel Patch, Camp Wildcat, Luner, Pitts, London, Stanton, East Bernstadt, Victory, Knowlton, Carmichael, Mershons, Lamero, Pittsburg, Templer, Atlanta, Peoples, Parrot, Eberle, Deese, Dabolt, Carico, Middlefork and Ardery. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 21 and 24. Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 1. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 38 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 20 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Powell; Pulaski; Rockcastle
